extendedInfo.description: [steel shapes] is the best designed, easiest to use & feature rich structural steel reference on Google Play today![steel shapes] contains the latest (v14), previous (ASD5 through v13) and historic AISC Structural Steel Shapes Databases used for beams, columns & other structural members in a fast, easy to use interface. Ranked among the 10 best Apps for Architects by ArchDaily.com! http://bit.ly/PlgYDr.The geometrical & mechanical properties for every section / profile in the AISC Structural Steel Shapes database (current and historic) are included and can be converted between unit systems.Over 16000 steel shapes entries from all libraries are included in a single app!FEATURES:----------------------------------------AISC LIBRARIES: (which we update as soon as AISC does)- Current version 14 & 14-SI- Versions 13.2 & 13.2 SI, 13.1.1, 13.1.1 SI, 13- LRFD 1st through 3rd Ed.- ASD 5th through 9th Ed.- HISTORICUNIT SYSTEM SWITCHING:----------------------------------------Properties can be displayed in either the original English units or converted to metric with  the click of a button. Including detailing fractional to standard metric.SORTING:----------------------------------------Sort sections within a library given a specific property in Ascending / Descending order (AISC Standard, Weight, Area, Inertia, plastic and section modulus, etc).  FAST AND FLEXIBLE SEARCH:----------------------------------------Find a section quickly and with less typing. For example,  "W16 x 89", "W16x89" or simply "W1689" will locate the same section or its closest approximation (W168 stops at W16 x 89).Find Equivalencies----------------------------------------Quickly find the Metric or Imperial equivalent designation of a section. Just type either the English or Metric Designation and you'll find its equivalent. Containing close to 2000 steel shapes!Types Information----------------------------------------View the Electronic and equivalent Engineering labels with their descriptions (Do you recall BCB sections?)AND NO ANNOYING ADS!!!!!*****************************************visit us at: www.TheMobileEngineer.com

reviews.title: Canada
reviews.comment: I would love to see a canadian version. Otherwise a great app. This developer\'s other steel apps are also useful.
reviews.author: Matthew Fielding

reviews.title: Needs CISC
reviews.comment: It would be amazing if you could add the CISC to this as well (You know, for us Canucks).
reviews.author: Alex Fry

reviews.title: Excellent software!
reviews.comment: Very useful and handy in the field, in the office & even in school. The author is also very prompt in replying to requests and suggestions. Highly recommended!
reviews.author: Michael Coprada

reviews.title: Finally for Android
reviews.comment: I used this app on my ipod thru school and was super excited to see it on the android market finally. So far it looks and operates great. I would like to eventually see the option to change the color scheme.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: This is an excellent app with an author that is quick to take care of his customers and address minor bugs. It\'s nice to see someone serious about creating a useful app instead of mucking something together that barely does what you need. I definitely recommend this author.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: A great tool for the field and as a quick reference. Love the imperial to metric equivalents.
reviews.author: A Google User
